titles.title: Quality Child Care Act of 2002

To amend the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 to increase the amount of funds allocated to activities to improve the quality of child care and to require that some of the funds so allocated be available to pay costs incurred by eligible child care providers to obtain accreditation from nationally recognized organizations.

term.name: Federal aid to day care centers

bill.summary: 4/10/2002--Introduced. Quality Child Care Act of 2002 - Amends the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 to: (1) increase the portion of funds allocated to activities to improve the quality of child care; and (2) require at least half of such funds to be used to assist eligible child care providers to obtain accreditation from nationally recognized organizations.
